answers.answer: If you feel like this is not your normal urinary pattern and more like a UTI, then don't let it wait.  You mentioned that you are urinating more frequently and in smaller amounts and the odor has changed.  Some of this could be from drinking more water, but it could also be signs of a UTI.  Without testing the urine, we won't know.  I suggest you get it checked out sooner rather than later esp. since you have a history of an auto-immune disease.  Keep your doctor's appt. for now (you can always reschedule it; they may want you to see him/her after taking antibiotics).  Let us know how you do.

question: I did a lot of water mostly carbonated flavoured water as I don't like plain water much. I've noticed that my urine smells a lot ammonia, I tend to go to the toilet a lot especially at night time and sometimes when I go it's only a little bit that passes. I've also started experiencing lower back pain so I'm worried this maybe a bit more than a uti I also suffer from incontinence problems due to a previous autoimmune disease. I've booked a doctor's appointment which is not for another week but I'm worried I'm leaving it to late should I go to a&e instead and what could it be? I know it's not diabetes as my mum has diabetes I've not lost any weight and I check my sugar levels on her machine which all seems normal. Please help thanks
title: strong smell of ammonia when I urinate
